alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:34PM EST until February 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. .Heavy rain and snowmelt from Thursday will continue to produce flooding. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Churchville. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage, more widespread agricultural land flooding, some backyard and basement flooding Churchville to Chili but minimal damages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 6.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 05/07/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1145 AM EST.
